snippet: As the Kremlin announced it had sent a convoy of humanitarian aid to Ukraine, NATO said there was a “high probability” of a Russian attack.
abstract: NATO says there is 'high probability' of Russian intervention in eastern Ukraine, and Ukraine raises its estimate of Russian troop strength on the border; adding to concern, residents in eastern Ukraine's Donetsk awake to learn that a stray rocket broke open a gate of a high-security prison, allowing more than 100 convicts to escape.

byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: As the Kremlin announced it had sent a convoy of humanitarian aid to Ukraine, NATO said there was a “high probability” of a Russian attack.

headline.main: Russian Intervention in Ukraine Is Likely, NATO Says
headline.print_headline: Russian Intervention in Ukraine Is Likely, NATO Says

keywords.value: International Committee of the Red Cross
keywords.name: organizations
